slides.title: What is .NET?
slides.content:
# One Platform ðŸŒ

.NET (formerly .NET Core) is a free, cross-platform, open source developer platform.

It runs on Windows, Linux, and macOS.

**C#** is the primary language used to build .NET apps.

slides.title: C# Basics
slides.content:
# The Language ðŸŽ¼

Similar to Java, but evolved faster.

- **Type Safe:** Strongly typed.
- **LINQ:** Powerful query syntax for collections.
- **Async/Await:**  native async support (invented here!).

slides.title: ASP.NET Core
slides.content:
# Web Framework ðŸ•¸ï¸

High-performance framework for building modern web apps.

- **MVC:** Model View Controller pattern.
- **Minimal APIs:** New, lightweight syntax (Node-like).
- **Blazor:** Run C# in the browser (via WebAssembly).

slides.title: LINQ
slides.content:
# LINQ ðŸ”

**Language Integrated Query**.

Query arrays, lists, XML, or SQL databases with the exact same syntax.

```csharp
var voters = users.Where(u => u.Age >= 18)
                  .OrderBy(u => u.Name)
                  .ToList();
```

slides.title: Dependency Injection
slides.content:
# Built-in DI ðŸ’‰

ASP.NET Core has DI built into the framework core.

```csharp
builder.Services.AddScoped<IMyService, MyService>();
```
No third-party libraries needed.
